intro: Basananthe aciphylla, commonly known as the spiny poinsettia, is a tropical shrub native to Central America. It is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and showy, colorful bracts that resemble flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. Its growth habit is typically compact, with multiple stems forming a bushy structure. Basananthe aciphylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and hardy nature.
